results.title: Why don’t homes in Britain have air-conditioning?
results.abstract: It’s usually not hot enough to need it, and homes were built to retain heat, not stay cool.

media.caption: Attempting to keep out the sun and heat at a home near Reading in Britain on Monday.

results.title: What Pregnancy and Childbirth Do to the Bodies of Young Girls
results.abstract: An Ohio 10-year-old’s recent abortion has generated fierce debate. Doctors in countries where pregnancy is common in adolescents say the toll of childbirth on young bodies is brutal.

media.caption: An X-ray of a healthy 10-year-old girl. Doctors who work in countries with underage pregnancies say a critical health issue is that the pelvis of a child is too small to allow passage of even a small fetus.
